text: Seriously thinking about buying this for myself...#Avengers

author: TerriGivens

text: Daily sinking to new lows.
author: TerriGivens

text: I'm also looking forward to some great discourse analysis.
author: TerriGivens

text: Looking forward to all the game theory analyses of #Brexit in the next round of poli-sci dissertations...
author: TerriGivens

text: I look forward to the day when I don't have to hear almost every day about somebody's emails, ethics, abuse of power, etc...of course as a political scientist, it's par for the course, but seriously...the last couple of years have been too much.
author: TerriGivens

text: Thanks for the invitation - looking forward to meeting you and the folks from @CARR in person!
author: TerriGivens

text:
My next event is in DC Thursday the 28th at @AmericanU 
HATE COMES TO CAMPUS
2:30-4 p.m. Hate Comes to Campus: Free Speech and the Future of Campus Community. 
4-5 p.m. Reception
5-6:30 p.m. Hate Comes to Campus: The Radical Right and Higher Education
author: TerriGivens

text: Props to NPR for talking to political scientists about this, but @womenalsoknow
author: TerriGivens

text:
A thoughtful look at the #AdmissionsScandal
From a professor at USC
author: TerriGivens

text: When would he need to be picked up?
author: TerriGivens

text: If you like what I'm saying (and writing!) about diversity, check out my new organization The Center for Higher Education Leadership - @center_higher and get in touch. I'm always looking for like-minded folks who want to talk about #diversity in #highered.
author: TerriGivens

text: Leadership matters when it comes to a focus on diversity in the faculty. It's important for top leaders to set the tone and encourage departments to do the work #IHEdiversity
author: TerriGivens

text: "Retention even after tenure is an issue" - don't I know it!!! Thanks for focusing on this issue @ScottJaschik - there needs to be a focus on growing talent, rather than just moving people around. #IHEdiversity
author: TerriGivens

text: I can't leave out my latest column which addresses "The Pregnancy Penalty" #IHEdiversity
author: TerriGivens

text: I have been talking about the importance of mentors since my first column in @insidehighered in 2009 - but keep in in mind that peers from similar backgrounds can also be helpful. #IHEdiversity
author: TerriGivens

text:
I talk about some of these issue in my column in @insidehighered from April of 2017, https://www.insidehighered.com/advice/2017/04/27/successful-black-academic-considers-twists-and-turns-her-career-essay …
#IHEdiversity
author: TerriGivens

text: Prestige of the undergraduate institution is an important component of graduate admissions decisions as @JuliePosselt has found, and yet there are many students out there who are very well qualified, here's where the pipeline is problematic #IHEdiversity
author: TerriGivens

text: Glad to hear @ScottJaschik mention empathy - it is a critical component for dealing with diversity issues. Also, I think it is important to look at rates of completion and how successful programs are in getting jobs (academic or not) for their students. #IHEdiversity
author: TerriGivens

text: Intention is lacking in many areas of #highered. Often diversity is already there and the colleges are trying to catch up with a focus on inclusion and programming to reach these students. It's critical for retention of both students and faculty. #IHEDiversity
author: TerriGivens

text: I agree that we need to figure out how to identify students that we used to consider "minorities" that are now the majority on many campuses. Even at @menlocollege with 750 students, the campus had become "majority minority" when I arrived there in 2015. #IHEdiversity.
author: TerriGivens

text: Checking out a new report from @insidehighered on diversifying the faculty and the graduate pipeline - a webinar with @ScottJaschik  #IHEdiversity - there are lots of types of diversity, I would mention neurodiversity, many colleges are working with these students.
author: TerriGivens

text: So sorry...Dolce sends her love.
author: TerriGivens

text: Monday night thoughts...
author: TerriGivens

author: TerriGivens

text: I don't mind chiming in, although this stuff is easy to Google, there's @DrIbram's book - Stamped from the Beginning: The Definitive History of Racist Ideas in America (National Book Award Winner)
author: TerriGivens

text: Yep, most of the athletes I have had were very disciplined and performed well in my classes. I was an athlete as well, and I can testify to the demands they have to meet.
author: TerriGivens

text: I wrote this last year, reposting in light of the #AdmissionsScandal
author: TerriGivens

text: It can be overwhelming, the attacks on our capabilities, the scandals showing that the scales are truly weighted against us, the horrific attacks that remind us that we are targets...yes, I have led a privileged life, but that is in despite of a system that wasn't designed for me
author: TerriGivens

text: “The seed of Nazism’s ultimate objective—the preservation of a pure white race, uncontaminated by foreign blood—was in fact sown with striking success in the United States.” @adamserwer on white nationalism’s deep American roots:
author: TerriGivens

text: This should be required reading for all, we can't get past the ugly history until we acknowledged it and reckon with the damage it has done to non-whites, particularly African Americans and Native Americans.
author: TerriGivens

text: The College Admission Scandal Is A Reminder Of A Broken System Against Black Folks
author: TerriGivens
